intro: Cryptantha pterocarya, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to the landscape. The plant has a compact, shrub-like structure with woody stems and small, leathery leaves.
